etymologies: 1920s. From modern Greek ρασοϕόρος monk of the lowest degree of the monastic hierarchy in the Eastern Orthodox Church from Byzantine Greek ῥάσον kind of napless woollen cloth, garment made of this cloth, especially monk's outer garment, cassock (from classical Latin rāsus smooth, past participle of rādere to scrape, rub smooth) + ancient Greek -ϕόρος

definitions: A monk or nun of the lowest degree in the monastic hierarchy of the Eastern Orthodox Church.
